snippet: Feyisa Lilesa, the silver medal winner in the Rio Olympics marathon who made an antigovernment gesture, said he feared punishment if he were to go home....
abstract: Feyisa Lilesa, Ethiopian marathoner who made antigovernment hand gesture while crossing finish line in second place at 2016 Olympics, will not return home, opting instead to remain in Brazil with his immigration status unclear; has expressed fear that his action will bring repercussion from Ethiopia's repressive government should he return home.
lead_paragraph: Feyisa Lilesa, the silver medal winner in the Rio Olympics marathon who made an antigovernment gesture, said he feared punishment if he were to go home.

headline.main: Ethiopian Runner Won’t Return Home, but Doesn’t Know Where to Go
headline.print_headline: Unsure of Next Stop, Ethiopian Runner Knows It’s Not Home
